msDesc.head: Chrysostom, Anselm, Alcuin, Boethius, and saints lives; Germany (Eberbach), c. 1200/1210

msItem.title: Calendrical verses
msItem.note: With a table from 1064–1588 (in eight-year intervals)
msItem.rubric: Hic tua picta metris Dyonisi pagina floret
msItem.incipit: Bis grege gens timuit cassari cras pateat pax
msItem.note: Instructions for using the verses are in the right-hand column:
msItem.rubric: Hec nequit ornatis describi pagina uerbis
msItem.incipit: Dictio preponit punctum monosillaba queuis

msItem.author: John Chrysostom
msItem.title: Homilies on Hebrews
msItem.rubric: Incipit expositio beati Iohannis cognomento Crisostomi in Epistolam ad Ebreos
msItem.incipit: Multifarie et multis modis olim Deus locutus est
msItem.explicit: cum quo patri, gloria una cum sancto spiritu, imperium honor nunc et semper et in secula seculorum. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit commentarium Iohannis episcopi Constantinopolitani in epistola Pauli apostoli ad Hebreos ex notis editum post eius obitum a Constante presbitero Antioceno et translatum est de Greco in Latinum a Muciano scolastico.

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Cur Deus homo
msItem.rubric: Prefatio Anshelmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi in libro Cur Deus homo
msItem.incipit: Opus subditum quod propter quosdam
Prologus anshelmi de incarnatione verbi. Quamvis post apostolos sancti patres
Sepe et studiose a multis rogatus sum
msItem.explicit: non nobis attribuere debemus qui est bene dictus in secula. Amen.

msItem.author: Wandalbertus (c. 813–870)
msItem.title: Life of St Goar
msItem.rubric: In Christi nomine incipit prologus Wandalberti diaconi in vitam et actus atque miracula beati Goaris, editus ad illustrem virum Marcwardum, abbatem monasterii Prumie
msItem.incipit: Miracula divinorum operum humano generi
Goar igitur Aquitanie provincies
msItem.finalRubric: Libellus de vita et actibus sancti ac beatissimi Goaris confessoris, editus a Wandalberto diacono, ex precepto Marcuuardi abbatis. Explicit feliciter.

msItem.author: Wandalbertus (c. 813–870)
msItem.title: Miracles of St Goar
msItem.rubric: Incipit alter de miraculis que gesta sunt apud memoriam sancti Goaris, ex quo ecclesia eius edificari cepta est feliciter.
msItem.incipit: Explicitis iam que vita
Sed ut ad narrationem veniam, cella S. Goaris
msItem.explicit: que inserenda prudens aliquis estimaverit, opportune possit inserere.

msItem.title: Life of St Giles
msItem.incipit: Sanctorum quidem me propensiori cultu

msItem.title: Passio S. Iacobi apostolis fratris S. Iohannis evangeliste
msItem.incipit: Apostolus Domini nostri Ihesu Christi Iacob, frater beati Iohannis apostoli et evangeliste omnem Iudeam et Samariam visitabat

msItem.author: Ps.-Salonius
msItem.title: Interrogationes et responsiones in Proverbiis
msItem.incipit: Parabole Salomonis filii David regis Israel. Interrogatio. Parabole qua lingua dicuntur? Responsio. Greca, latina vero interpretantur similitudines.
msItem.explicit: Ille solus qui Deum timet, et mandata eius custodit.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: Quaestiones in Genesim
msItem.incipit: Quomodo convenit quod in Genesi legitur? Requievit Deus die septimo
msItem.explicit: absque sorte dedisse eam tribui Joseph, et mausoleum eius ibi hodieque cernitur.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: De benedictionibus patriarcharum
msItem.incipit: Quid intelligendum est de benedictionibus quibus Iacob patriarcha benedixit filios suos
msItem.explicit: Ascensor equi est quisquis iniquitatibus huius mundi extollitur, qui retro cadere dicitur.
msItem.note: Part of Quaestiones in Genesim, printed as Interrogatio 231 in PL 100, 558–566; Stegmüller, Bibl. 1085.
Boethius, Opuscula sacra, with marginal and interlinear gloss attributed to Remigius of Auxerre.

msItem.author: Boethius
msItem.title: Opuscula sacra I-V (De trinitate)
msItem.rubric: Anicii Manlii Severini Boethii V. C. et illustr. ex consulis ordinarii Patricii liber incipit. Quomodo Trinitas ...
msItem.incipit: Investigatam diutissme questionem quantum nostre mentis
Christiane religionis reverentiam plures usurpant

msItem.author: Remigius of Auxerre (?)
msItem.title: Commentarium in Boethii Opuscula sacra
msItem.incipit: questione sub. de sancta trinitate igniculum id est ingeniolum
msItem.explicit: [cuncta sunt bona] iustum est deo tamen donante

note.bibl: Pr. (as John Erigena) by E. K. Rand, Johannes Scottus: I: Der Kommentar des Johannes Scottus zu den Opuscula sacra des Boethius. II: Der Kommentar des Remigius von Auxerre zu den Opuscula sacra des Boethius, Quellen und Untersuchungen zur lateinischen Philologie des Mittelalters, I.2 (Munich, 1906), 30–80.

msItem.note: Gloss preceded by text on the names in the title, cf. Anicii Manlii Severini Boetii Philosophiae consolationis libri quinque. Accedunt eiusdem atque incertorum opuscula sacra, ed. R. Peiper (1871), xxxiv n.
msItem.incipit: Anicius ab anno dictus eo quod optabant annosum fieri

msItem.title: Life of St Pelagia
Incipit conversio Sanctae Pelagiae
msItem.incipit: Verba sacerdotis tanti et celata Latinis Eustochius famulus Christi
Sacratissimus episcopus Antiochie civitatis convocavit ante se
msItem.explicit: et nos faciat Dominus invenire misericordiam in die iudicii, cui est honor et gloria in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Life, translation and miracles of St Servatius

msItem.rubric: Incipit vita sancti Servacii episcopi et confessoris
msItem.incipit: Ad illuminandum genus humanum
Erant in diebus illis Iudeorum in partibus
msItem.explicit: impendia sepulture sollempniter exacta sunt, cooperante signis et virtutibus illo cuius regnum et imperium sine fine permanet in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.incipit: Post huius obitum Huni, subversis multis Gallie urbibus
msItem.explicit: obsecramus per eundem Christum Dominum nostrum.

msItem.incipit: Ad excolendam autem dominicam vineam
msItem.explicit: quod magni meriti apud Deum credimus esse, nil scriptum invenire potuimus. De his hactenus nunc de beati translatione Servatii pauca perstringemus.

msItem.incipit: Karolo magno monarchiam regni gubernante sarracenorum phalanges
msItem.explicit: Sed quia nimis longum est si universa particulariter enarrare velimus, Dei hec operantis magnificentiam universaliter laudemus, cui sit laus et gloria in omnia secula. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit de translatione et miraculis gloriosi confessoris et episcopi Servacii

msItem.title: Life of St Lubentius
msItem.incipit: Beatus igitur Lubentius a parentibus suis sancto Martino
msItem.explicit: et divinae gratiae benedictionibus per omne evum mirificavit.

decoDesc.decoNote: Arabesque or silhouette initials in red, green, and red-and-green.
Fol. 22r, decorated initial with foliate and animal motifs.

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.

history.provenance: Attributed by Palmer (p. 109) to the Eberbach scriptorium.
Eberbach, Cistercian abbey: characteristic marginal annotations.
Fols. 115v-129r: Identifiable as 'Erb. Mi. 143' in the "Rheinischen Gesamtkatalog" from the 1470s (now Basel, Öffentliche Bibliothek der Universität, cod. F VI 53, pp. 1–28, on p. 4).
Identifiable as d 5 in the Eberbach library catalogue of 1502.
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted by Tuija Ainonen (December 2019) from the following sources (with additional description of the contents): Nigel F. Palmer, Zisterzienser und ihre Bücher: die mittelalterliche Bibliotheksgeschichte von Kloster Eberbach im Rheingau (Regensburg, 1998), pp. 106, 209–10, 227, 295 [physical description, date, origin, provenance] Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, 3 vols. (1966–1973) I, no. 105. H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885 [contents, acquisition]
Quarto Catalogue, col. 328 Quarto Catalogue, col. 329 Quarto Catalogue, p. 563 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 50

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Polonsky digitization project to include additional information from printed descriptions.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
